resources.string: inmidtown represents the interests of 560 businesses in Holborn, Bloomsbury and St. Giles. We deliver tangible benefits for our members by providing practical, cost-effective services such as recycling and joint procurement.

We also aim to add value to the work of Camden Council and Transport for London in the areas of street management, public realm and transport. As well as seeking to influence and encourage local business leaders and key decision makers at the Council and in the Mayor’s Office, we work closely with organisations such as the Midtown Business Club.
Our aim is to make Bloomsbury, Holborn and St. Giles a quality environment in which to work and live, a vibrant area to visit and a profitable place to do business.
The Eco App has been designed and developed by the Mobile and Ubiquitous Computing students at the Department of Computer Science, Birkbeck College, University of London.

Concept and UI design: Hesseltje S van Goor and Tracey Field; Software Development: Giorgio Huang, Chatitze Moumin and David McRobert; Analytics: Ray Su; Illustrations: William Jesus Maria Jose Bates; Sound: Philip Wickens; TAs: Richard Brownlow and Long Chen; Lecturer: George Roussos
